page.title: 19FARMING, HAYDON BRIDGE.
page.content: Our area is typical of the South Tyne valley-dominated by agriculture .Many lowland farms grow 40% barley & 60% ley grass.Over the 400ft.contour the main crop is grass,both permanent & ley.In the northern sector,wet moorland & rough pasture predominate. All this supports cattle & sheep. Most farmers have given up Dairy farming, {though the School's farm's chief {enterprise is its dairy unit.}Some {land }is owned by Northumberland Co.Council,some by the Catholic Trust & the{Greenwich Hospital Trust}& the names of Prior House & Prior field commemorate the era before 1540 when {Hexham Priory}owned much land.Woodland provides shelter belts,anchors river banks & provides a cash crop for some farmers.We are well-served by the{A.69 which connects Tyne/Wear to the M6.
